page.title: 01INTRODUCTION _ CHIGNALS
page.content: Chignal Smealy and Chignal St. James and Mashbury are found in the South East of England in Essex. The area is 7 km north west of Chelmsford. All the villages in this area are part of the Chelmsford County Court District. The height ranges from 46-61 metres and there is a gradual slope. To the north of Chignal Smealy there is a watershed between the River Can and Chignal Smealy brook, which drains the majority of the area. In this area there are three main villages which contain a vast amount of history. The major land use is farming and there are four major farms in the area. It is a natural countryside with a few woods and reservoirs. It has poor communications and has only one small factory and a
